par.text: Chlorine is a greenish-yellow gas with a sharp, choking odour, extremely irritating to the respiratory system. It is poisonous. This property of chlorine was employed during the First World War. Obtained for the first time by the Swedish chemist Karl Wilhelm Scheele in 1774. In 1810 the English chemist Humphry Davy proved that chlorine is an element and named it for its colour (the Greek
means greenish-yellow). Chlorine is very reactive and reacts with most elements to form chlorides. It combines with hydrogen to produce hydrogen chloride - HCl.
